name: Outlook
description:
# Outlook MCP Server
![Outlook MCP Server](https://img.shields.io/badge/Outlook-MCP%20Server-blue?style=for-the-badge&logo=microsoft-outlook) ![Python](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-3.13+-green?style=for-the-badge&logo=python) ![FastMCP](https://img.shields.io/badge/FastMCP-2.10.4+-orange?style=for-the-badge) ![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow?style=for-the-badge) _A powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Microsoft Outlook integration, providing comprehensive email management capabilities through Microsoft Graph API._
## ğŸ“§ Overview The Outlook MCP Server is a high-performance, feature-rich server that enables seamless integration with Microsoft Outlook through the Model Context Protocol. Built with FastMCP and Python 3.13+, it provides a comprehensive set of tools for email management, including reading, sending, organizing, and managing Outlook messages, drafts, and folders. ### âœ¨ Key Features - ğŸ” **OAuth2 Authentication** - Secure Microsoft OAuth integration via Azure AD - ğŸ“¨ **Complete Email Management** - Read, send, draft, and organize emails - ğŸ“ **Folder Management** - List and navigate Outlook mail folders - ğŸ” **Advanced Search** - Powerful query-based email filtering - ğŸ“ **Attachment Support** - List, download, and read email attachments - ğŸš€ **Streamable HTTP** - High-performance streaming capabilities - ğŸ³ **Docker Ready** - Containerized deployment with Docker Compose - ğŸ§ª **Comprehensive Testing** - Full test coverage with pytest - ğŸ“Š **Microsoft Graph API** - Native integration with Microsoft 365 services - ğŸ”„ **Async Operations** - Non-blocking asynchronous email operations ## ğŸ“š Available Tools ### ğŸ“ Folder Management #### `list_mail_folders` Lists all available Outlook mail folders. **Returns:** - `folders` (list): List of folder objects with id, display_name, parent_folder_id, child_folder_count, unread_item_count, total_item_count ### ğŸ“¨ Email Management #### `list_emails` Lists emails in an Outlook folder with filtering options. **Parameters:** - `folder_id` (str): The ID of the folder to list emails in (optional) - `start` (str): RFC3339 formatted start date and time (optional) - `end` (str): RFC3339 formatted end date and time (optional) - `limit` (str): Maximum number of emails to return (default: 100) - `read_status` (str): Filter by read status ('read', 'unread', or empty for all) #### `get_email_details` Get the details of an Outlook email. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): The ID of the email to get details for - `group_id` (str): Group mailbox ID (optional, for group emails) - `thread_id` (str): Thread ID (optional, for group emails) #### `search_emails` Search for emails in Outlook with multiple criteria. **Parameters:** - `subject` (str): Search query for email subject (optional) - `from_address` (str): Search query for sender email address (optional) - `from_name` (str): Search query for sender name (optional) - `folder_id` (str): Folder ID to search in (optional) - `start` (str): Start date and time in RFC 3339 format (optional) - `end` (str): End date and time in RFC 3339 format (optional) - `limit` (str): Maximum number of emails to return (default: 10) ### ğŸ“ Draft Management #### `create_draft` Create (but do not send) a draft individual Outlook email. **Parameters:** - `subject` (str): The subject of the email - `body` (str): The body of the email in markdown format - `recipients` (str): Comma-separated list of email addresses (no spaces) - `cc` (str): Comma-separated list of CC email addresses (optional) - `bcc` (str): Comma-separated list of BCC email addresses (optional) - `attachments` (str): Comma-separated list of workspace file paths (optional) - `reply_email_id` (str): ID of email to reply to (optional) - `reply_all` (bool): Whether to reply to all (default: false) #### `send_draft` Send an existing draft email in Outlook. **Parameters:** - `draft_id` (str): The ID of the draft to send ### ğŸ”§ Email Actions #### `delete_email` Delete an Outlook email. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): The ID of the email to delete #### `move_email` Moves an email to a different Outlook folder. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): The ID of the email to move - `destination_folder_id` (str): The ID of the destination folder ### ğŸ‘¤ Account Information #### `get_my_email_address` Get the email address of the currently authenticated Outlook user. **Returns:** - `email` (str): The user's email address ### ğŸ“ Attachment Management #### `list_attachments` List the attachments of an Outlook email. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): The ID of the email to list attachments for **Returns:** - `attachments` (list): List of attachment objects with id, name, content_type, size, is_inline #### `download_attachment` Download an attachment from an Outlook email into workspace. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): The ID of the email containing the attachment - `attachment_id` (str): The ID of the attachment to download #### `read_attachment` Get the markdown converted contents of an attachment from an Outlook email. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): The ID of the email containing the attachment - `attachment_id` (str): The ID of the attachment to read **Returns:** - `content` (str): The text content of the attachment (for text-based files) - `error` (str): Error message for binary attachments ---
**Built with â¤ï¸ using FastMCP and Microsoft Graph API** [![GitHub stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/your-repo/outlook-mcp-server?style=social)](https://github.com/your-repo/outlook-mcp-server) [![GitHub forks](https://img.shields.io/github/forks/your-repo/outlook-mcp-server?style=social)](https://github.com/your-repo/outlook-mcp-server)

toolPreview.name: list_mail_folders
toolPreview.description: Lists all available Outlook mail folders.

toolPreview.name: list_emails
toolPreview.description: Lists emails in an Outlook folder with filtering options.

params.folder_id: The ID of the folder to list emails in (optional)
params.start: RFC3339 formatted start date and time (optional)
params.end: RFC3339 formatted end date and time (optional)
params.limit: Maximum number of emails to return (default: 100)
params.read_status: Filter by read status (read, unread, or empty for all)

toolPreview.name: get_email_details
toolPreview.description: Get the details of an Outlook email.

params.email_id: The ID of the email to get details for
params.group_id: Group mailbox ID (optional, for group emails)

toolPreview.name: search_emails
toolPreview.description: Search for emails in Outlook with multiple criteria.

params.subject: Search query for email subject (optional)
params.from_address: Search query for sender email address (optional)
params.start: Start date and time in RFC 3339 format (optional)
params.end: End date and time in RFC 3339 format (optional)
params.limit: Maximum number of emails to return (default: 10)

toolPreview.description: Create (but do not send) a draft individual Outlook email.

params.subject: The subject of the email
params.body: The body of the email in markdown format
params.recipients: Comma-separated list of email addresses (no spaces)
params.cc: Comma-separated list of CC email addresses (optional)
params.bcc: Comma-separated list of BCC email addresses (optional)
params.attachments: Comma-separated list of workspace file paths (optional)
params.reply_email_id: ID of email to reply to (optional)
params.reply_all: Whether to reply to all (default: false)

toolPreview.description: Send an existing draft email in Outlook.

params.draft_id: The ID of the draft to send

params.email_id: The ID of the email to delete
